utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, Rach, we're running low on resumes over here.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you really want a job with Popular Mechanics?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, if you're gonna work for mechanics, those are the ones to work for.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, look, you guys, I'm going for anything here, OK? I cannot be a waitress anymore, I mean it. I'm sick of the lousy tips, I'm sick of being called 'Excuse me...'

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Rach, did you proofread these?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh... yeah, why?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, nothing, I'm sure they'll be impressed with your excellent compuper skills.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my Goood! Oh, do you think it's on all of them?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh no, I'm sure the Xerox machine caught a few.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Chandler and Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey... hi, ladies... uh, can I get you anything? : Did you bring the mail?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Lots of responses.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: : Really? : Sure, we have scones left! : OK, read them to me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: : Dear Ms. Green, thank you for your inquiry, however... oh...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: : We have apple cinnamon...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: : OK... Dear Ms. Green... yeah... yeah... yeah... No.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: : Your Visa bill is huge!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Give me that!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know, I can't believe you. Linda is so great! Why won't you go out with her again?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is this still about her whole 'The Flintstones could've really happened' thing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, it's not just that. It's just—I want someone who... who does something for me, y'know? Who gets my heart pounding, who... who makes me, uh...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ...little playthings with yarn?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Could you want her more?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Dee, the sarcastic sister from Whats Happening.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, I am totally, totally over her, OK, I just... : Hiiii!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! How are you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We're fine, we're fine.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Shut up!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We're not—we're not saying anything.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uhhhh... Joey cried last night.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We were playing poker, alright...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: There was chocolate on the three. It looked like an eight, alright?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, guys, you should've seen him. 'Read 'em and weep.'

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And then he did.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, now, how come you guys have never played poker with us?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, what is that? Like, some kind of guy thing? Like, some kind of sexist guy thing? Like it's poker, so only guys can play?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, women are welcome to play.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, OK, so then what is it? Some kind of... you know, like, like... some kind of, y'know, like... alright, what is it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: There just don't happen to be any women in our games.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, we just don't happen to know any women that know how to play poker.

utterance.speaker: Girls
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, right.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, please, that is such a lame excuse!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I mean, that's a typical guy response.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Excuse me, do any of you know how to play?

utterance.speaker: Girls
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But you could teach us.

utterance.speaker: Guys
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: OK, so now we draw cards.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So I wouldn't need any, right? Cause I have a straight.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, good for you!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Congratulations!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: OK Phoebs, how many do you want?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: OK, I just need two... the, um, ten of spades and the six of clubs.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No. No, uh, Phoebs? You can't—you can't do...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh wait, I have the ten of spades! Here!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no. Uh... no, see, uh, you-you can't do that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no, that's OK, I don't need them. I'm going for fours.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, you're...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Alright, here we go. We've got salmon roulettes and assorted crudites.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
utterance.content: OOooooo!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, Monica, what're you doin'? This is a poker game. You can't serve food with more than one syllable. It's gotta be like chips, or dip, or pretz...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: OK, so at this point, the dealer...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Alright, you know, we got it, we got it. Let's play for real. High stakes... big bucks...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Alright, now, you sure? Phoebe just threw away two jacks because they didn't look happy...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But... I'm ready, so, just deal.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: OK, alright, last minute lesson, last minute lesson. Joey... three... eight. Eight... three. Alright babe, deal the cards.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Dammit, dammit, dammit!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: : Oh I see, so then, you were lying.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: About how good your cards were.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Heh... I was bluffing.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: A-ha! And... what is bluffing? Is it not another word for... lying?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: OK, sorry to break up this party, but I've got resumes to fax before work tomorrow...

utterance.speaker: Guys
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Rach, Rach, we gotta settle.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Settle what?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The... Jamestown colony of Virginia. You see, King George is giving us the land, so...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The game, Rachel, the game. You owe us money for the game.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh. Right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You know what, you guys? It's their first time, why don't we just forget about the money, alright?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hell no, we'll pay!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: OK, Monica? I had another answer all ready.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And you know what? We want a rematch.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well that's fine with me. Could use the money.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: : So basically, you get your ya-yas by taking money from all of your friends.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ...Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, and I get my ya-yas from Ikea. You have to put them together yourself, but they cost a little less.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, Rachel, this is poker. I play to win, alright? In order for me to win, other people have to lose. So if you're gonna play poker with me, don't expect me to be a 'nice guy,' OK? Cause once those cards are dealt...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: ...Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm not a nice guy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Alright boys, let's eat.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, did you get that from the 'I Love Rachel' pizzeria?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You still on that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, come on. What was with that whole Black Bart speech? : "When I play poker, I'm not a nice guy!"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You are way off, pal.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, I don't think so, see Ross, because I think you love her.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Um.... no. See, I might've had feelings for her at one time—not any more. I just—I...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Marcel! Where are you going with that disc?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You are not putting that on again! Marcel, OK—if you press that button, you are in very, very big trouble.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Can you believe what a jerk Ross was being?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. He can get really competitive.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ha. Ha, ha.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, hello, kettle? This is Monica. You're black.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Please! I am not as bad as Ross.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I beg to differ. The Pictionary incident?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That was not an incident! I-I was gesturing, a-and the plate slipped out of my hand.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oooooh. : Oh! I got an interview! I got an interview!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You're kidding! Where? Where?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: : Sak's... Fifth... Avenue.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, it's like the mother ship is calling you home.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, what's the job?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Assistant buyer. Oh! I would be shopping... for a living!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: OK, look. That is Aunt Iris. This woman has been playing poker since she was five. You gotta listen to every word she says. Hi!

utterance.speaker: Aunt Iris
utterance.content: Is Tony Randall dead?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don't think so.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Aunt Iris
utterance.content: Well, he may be now, because I think I hit him with my car.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Aunt Iris
utterance.content: No! That's bluffing. Lesson number one. Let me tell you something... everything you hear at a poker game is pure crap. : Nice earrings.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thank y...

utterance.speaker: Aunt Iris
utterance.content: Girls, sit down.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh, Aunt Iris? This is Phoebe, and that's Rachel...

utterance.speaker: Aunt Iris
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, listen, I am parked at a meter. Let's do it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ross, could we please, please, please listen to anything else?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Alright.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm gonna pay for that tonight.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Guys! Guess what, guess what, guess what, guess what!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Um, ok... the... the fifth dentist caved and now they're all recommending Trident?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Noooo... the interview! She loved me! She absolutely loved me. We talked for like two and a half hours, we have the same taste in clothes, and—oh, I went to camp with her cousin... And, oh, the job is perfect. I can do this. I can do this well!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: That's great! That's wonderful!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God, oh, and then she told the funniest story...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: OK, great. You'll tell us and we'll laugh. Let's play poker.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Alright now listen, you guys, we talked about it, and if you don't want to play, we completely understand.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yes, yes, we could play some other game... like, uh, I don't know... Pictionary?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ha, ha, very funny, very funny. But I think we'd like to give poker another try. Shall we, ladies?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, we should. I think we should.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, Rach, do you want me to shuffle those?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, no, thats OK. Y'know, I think I'm gonna give it a go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Alright.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Alright...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, Phoebs owes $7.50, Monica, you owe $10, and Rachel, you owe fifteen big ones.

utterance.content: But hey, thanks for teachin' us Cross-Eyed Mary. You guys, we gotta play that at our regular game.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Alright, here's my $7.50. But I think you should know that this money is cursed.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I cursed it. So now bad things will happen to he who spends it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's alright, I'll take it. Bad things happen to me anyway. This way I can break 'em up with a movie.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, that just leaves the big Green poker machine, who owes fifteen...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Mmm-hmmm. Oh, so typical. Ooo, I'm a man. Ooo, I have a penis. Ooo, I have to win money to exert my power over women.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You know what? This is not over. We will play you again, and we will win, and you will lose, and you will beg, and we will laugh, and we will take every last dime you have, and you will hate yourselves forever.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hmm. Kinda stepped on my point there, Mon.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, you gals wanna hand over your money now? That way, we don't have to go through the formality of actually playing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooooh, that's fine. We'll see who has the last laugh there, monkey boy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: OK, we done with the chit-chat? Are we ready to play some serious poker?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey you guys, look, the one-eyed jack follows me wherever I go. Right, OK, serious poker.

utterance.content: Excuse me, where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh... to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you want to go to the bathroom, or do you wanna play poker?

utterance.content: I want to go to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Alright, well, I'm gonna order a pizza.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no-no-no, I'm still waiting to hear from that job and the store closes at nine, so you can eat then.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That's fine. I'll just have a Tic-Tac to hold me over.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Alright, Cincinnati, no blinds, everybody ante.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes! .... or no.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Alright. : Your money's mine, Green.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Your fly is open, Geller.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You guys, you know what I just realized? 'Joker' is 'poker' with a 'J.' Coincidence?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, that's... that's 'joincidence' with a 'C'!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh... Phoebe? Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Um... I'm out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm in.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.content: Me too. Alright, whattaya got.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, you better hop outta the shower, cause... I gotta flush.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, well, well, hop back in bucko, cause I got four sixes! I won! I actually won! Oh my God! Y'know what? I think I'm gonna make a little Ross pile. I think that one was Ross's, and I think—oh—that one was Ross's. Yes! : Well, I have got your money, and you'll never see it...

utterance.content: I hate this game!

utterance.content: OK Joey, your bet.

utterance.content: Ahhh, I fold like a cheap hooker who got hit in the stomach by a fat guy with sores on his face. Oh, I'm out.

utterance.content: Ross?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I am very in.

utterance.content: Chandler?

utterance.content: Couldn't be more out.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Me too. Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh, I will see you... and I'll raise you. What do you say... want to waste another buck?

utterance.content: No, not this time. So... what'd you have?

utterance.content: I'm not telling.

utterance.content: Come on, show them to me.

utterance.content: No..!

utterance.content: Get your hands out of there! No!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Let me see! Show them!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know, I've had dates like this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Boy, you really can't stand to lose, can you? Your whole face is getting red... little veins popping out on your temple...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Plus that shirt doesn't really match those pants.

utterance.speaker: Ross

utterance.content: Oh, you are losing. Definitely losing.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Let's not talk about losing. Just deal the...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Barbara! Hi, how are you? Uh-huh. No, I understand. Yeah. Oh, oh, come on, no, I'm fine. Don't be silly. Yeah... oh, but you know, if-if anything else opens up, plea—Hello? Hello?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.......OK. Where were we? Oh, OK... five card draw, uh... jacks or better... nothing wild, everybody ante.

utterance.content: Check.

utterance.content: Call.

utterance.content: I'm in.

utterance.content: I see your fifty cents... and I raise you... five dollars.

utterance.content: I thought, uh... it was a fifty cent limit.

utterance.content: Well, I just lost a job, and I'd like to raise the bet five bucks. Does anybody have a problem with that?

utterance.content: : Loser?
